item.title: unreachable statements
item.description: Sometimes, we will meet this compiler error: unreachable statements. See the following examples: public void javapapers() { System.out.println(&quot;java&quot;); return; System.out.println(&quot;papers&quot;); // compile error }public void javapapers() { System.out.println(&quot;java&quot;); if(true) { return; } System.out.println(&quot;papers&quot;); } //This code compiled successfullypublic void javapapers() { System.out.println(&quot;java&quot;); while(true) { return; } System.out.println(&quot;papers&quot;); // compile error } Wait, but what is strange here? From Java Language Specification: > ## 14.21.Â Unreachable Statements > It is a compile-time error if a statement cannot be executed because it is unreachable.
